ai-ud2.10:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Anupiya in a mango grove.
ai-ud2.10:1.3_0: Now at that time, Venerable Bhaddiya the son of Kāḷīgodhā, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, frequently expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.10:2.4_0: “Without a doubt, Venerable Bhaddiya leads the spiritual life dissatisfied. It’s when recalling the pleasures of royalty he formerly enjoyed as a lay person that, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, he frequently expresses this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.10:3.1_0: Then many monks went to the Fortunate One,
ai-ud2.10:3.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-ud2.10:3.3_0: “Sir, Venerable Bhaddiya the son of Kāḷigodhā, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, frequently expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.10:3.5_0: adding, “No doubt Bhaddiya is dissatisfied with the spiritual life.
ai-ud2.10:3.6_0: It’s when recalling his former happiness as a king that he is saying this.”
ai-ud2.10:4.1_0: Then the Fortunate One addressed a certain monk, (saying):
ai-ud2.10:4.2_0: “Please, monk, in my name tell the mendicant Bhaddiya that
ai-ud2.10:5.1_0: “Yes, sir,” that monk replied. He went to Bhaddiya and told him.
ai-ud2.10:5.1_1: and after going, he said this to his son Bhaddiya, Kāḷigodhā’s son:
ai-ud2.10:5.3_0: “Yes, reverend,” Bhaddiya replied. He went to the Buddha,
ai-ud2.10:6.1_0: “Is it really true, Bhaddiya, that even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, you frequently express this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.10:7.3_0: “Formerly, as a lay person ruling the land, my guard was well organized within and without the royal compound, within and without the city, and within and without the country.
ai-ud2.10:7.4_0: But although I was guarded and defended in this way, I remained fearful, scared, suspicious, and nervous.
ai-ud2.10:7.5_0: But these days, even when alone in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, I’m not fearful, scared, suspicious, or nervous. I live relaxed, unruffled, surviving on charity, my heart free as a wild deer.
ai-ud2.10:7.6_0: It is for this reason that, even in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty dwelling, I frequently expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.10:8.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.10:9.1_0: “For he who has no agitations inside (the mind),
ai-ud2.10:9.2_0: gone beyond any kind of existence;
ai-ud2.10:9.3_0: happy, free from fear and sorrow—
ai-ud2.10:9.4_0: Even the gods are unable to see them.”
ai-ud2.10:9.6_0: The second sub-chapter on powder is finished.
